  physical_appearance: This is a Chinese-style jacket with matching skirt. The edges are scalloped-shape
 and are trimmed with bugle beads. The silk fabric is patterned with floral motifs. On the front of the jacket
 there is a flower stalk formed by bugle beads. There are buttons along the decorative lining on the jacket and the skirt.

  subject_terms_1: flower (motif) folk costume

  subject_terms_2: Motifs Ethnic costume Skirts Jackets

  subject_terms_3: Chinese costumes

  sgcool_label_text: This jacket was worn with the matching skirt. The scalloped edges of the jacket and skirt are trimmed with bugle beads
 as are the faux cuffs and medallion details on both garments. Round buttons are here only used for decorative effect. Both jacket and skirt are secured by hooks and press studs. On the front is a flower stalk formed by bugle beads
 echoing the floral pattern of the silk fabric. Garments like these were fashionable in China in the 1920s
 especially among women in their late teens and early twenties.

metadata.title_text: Jacket with matching skirt Chinese jacket with matching skirt
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a Chinese-style jacket with matching skirt. The edges are scalloped-shape, and are trimmed with bugle beads. The silk fabric is patterned with floral motifs. On the front of the jacket, there is a flower stalk formed by bugle beads. There are buttons along the decorative lining on the jacket and the skirt.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This jacket was worn with the matching skirt. The scalloped edges of the jacket and skirt are trimmed with bugle beads, as are the faux cuffs and medallion details on both garments. Round buttons are here only used for decorative effect. Both jacket and skirt are secured by hooks and press studs. On the front is a flower stalk formed by bugle beads, echoing the floral pattern of the silk fabric. Garments like these were fashionable in China in the 1920s, especially among women in their late teens and early twenties.
